result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven A. Colby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license for the manner of operation. No contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
Any other counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven A. Colby

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 11:33 AM Defendant Steven A. Colby in court.  Attorney Wesley Kottke in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Larry J. Lloyd in court for Steven A. Colby. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by ADA Kottke. Statement by Atty Lloyd. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W - 12 months probation. Conditions: Any counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license for the manner of operation. No contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party. Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Larry J. Lloyd appeared by phone for Steven A. Colby. Atty Lloyd requests a P/S Hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
